definition: to offer/to give (as tribute)/to devote (one's life)/to sacrifice (oneself)
to offer/to present/to dedicate/to donate/to show/to put on display/worthy person (old)

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)

sentences.english: Entirely devoted to the Party, the young soldier gave his life for his country.
sentences.chinese: 对党无限忠诚，这位年轻的士兵为祖国献出了生命。

sentences.english: Those behave fawningly to rich one have no money received and that means they offer their soul, their dignity for nothing.
sentences.chinese: 奉承的人没有钱收而献出他们的灵魂他们的尊严。

sentences.english: Under the Mistletoes, let's give out our sweet kisses.
sentences.chinese: 在圣诞花环下，让我们献出甜吻。

sentences.english: Am I continually separating myself to consider God every day of my life?
sentences.chinese: 我是否每天不断地献出自己，只以神为念？

sentences.english: I encourage you to join the list and contribute your thoughts to the project.
sentences.chinese: 我鼓励您加入这个列表，并献出您对这个项目的想法。

sentences.english: The wood of the river and black Chuans all for exploring clear this malert: but dedicating own life.
sentences.chinese: 江木和黑川都是为了探明这件事而献出了自己的生命。

sentences.english: Without hesitation, the elephant king offered what was left of his tusks.
sentences.chinese: 象王没有丝毫犹豫就献出了自己余下的象牙。

sentences.english: Napoleon bragged that he could train men to sacrifice their lives for a scrap of ribbon.
sentences.chinese: 拿破仑吹嘘道他可以训练人们为了块破布而献出生命。

sentences.english: I dedicate today to minimalist health.
sentences.chinese: 我献出今天来达到简易健康。

sentences.english: After I donate my blood, will the organization sell it?
sentences.chinese: 我献出的血液，采供血机构会不会拿去卖掉呢？

sentences.english: I hope you will dedicate this day too.
sentences.chinese: 我希望你也会献出这一天。

sentences.english: Do you still remember those who lost their lives for the country?
sentences.chinese: 你还记得住那些为国家献出生命的人吗？

sentences.english: People may even be willing to die for their pets.
sentences.chinese: 甚至有人愿意为宠物献出自己的生命。

sentences.english: As spring gave the lifetime loyalty.
sentences.chinese: 就象那春蚕献出一生的忠诚。

sentences.english: This flower-girl now offered her blossom to the soul.
sentences.chinese: 这个献花女现在只向灵魂献出她的花朵了。

sentences.english: Numerous Russian young people sacrificed their lives for the victory of the Anti-Japanese War in China.
sentences.chinese: 许多俄罗斯青年为了中国抗日战争的胜利献出了生命。

definition: to offer respectfully/to consecrate/to dedicate/to devote
to offer/to present/to dedicate/to donate/to show/to put on display/worthy person (old)
to commit one's energy to/to devote oneself to/to sacrifice one's life for/(coll.) (of a woman) to give one's virginity to
to offer to God
to sacrifice one's life/to sacrifice (sth valued)/beast slaughtered as a sacrifice
willingly
to donate/to contribute/donation/contribution
to save/to rescue
to save/to remedy/to rescue
to sacrifice one's life
not stint/not spare/not hesitate (to do sth)/not scruple (to do sth)
bravery with no thought of personal safety (idiom); risking life and limb/undaunted by perils
to do all one can/to give all one has
to meet death
heroic/gallant/valiant
to risk one's life
